conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the camera is in an isometric-like elevated angle with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and good corner geometry; floor plane is distinct; interior volume reads well. Cutaway is clean with only minor simplification at some openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Core zones (dining left, kitchen top, living right, bedroom bottom-left, central wet area) broadly correspond, but there are notable layout deviations: entry/porch/stair placement differs from the 2D plan and some partition lengths/offsets do not match precisely.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present in correct general rooms (dining set, kitchen cabinetry, living seating, bed). Bathroom fixtures are simplified/partially represented; some elements from plan (wash/toilet separation) appear merged or not fully detailed.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with consistent materials and clean presentation; lighting supports visibility. Minor ambiguity in door/opening representation and some spaces are visually simplified.

detected_errors.description: Entrance/stair/porch region does not faithfully match the 2D plan (location and configuration differ), indicating layout distortion.
Several doors/openings are not clearly shown or do not align with the 2D door placements (swing/orientation and exact wall positions simplified).
Wet-area fixtures and the wash/toilet separation are simplified or partially missing relative to the 2D plan.

summary: A true, clean 3D cutaway with strong volumetric modeling, but with noticeable layout fidelity issues around the entry/stair zone and some simplified/mismatched openings and wet-area detailing.
